refnamediv.refpurpose: mouse selection of a set of points in a 2D axes

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: xy = locate() xy = locate(n) xy = locate(n, cross)

listitem.para:
integer:
n > 0 : number of points to be selected.
any n ≤ 0 : undefined number of points. Stops the selection by right-clicking.
Default value = -1.
When cross it set to 1, locate(.) displays a "X" mark at each clicked position in the current axes. Default = 0.
matrix of size (2,n1). n1=n if the parameter n is given. xy(1,:) are abscissae. xy(2,:) are ordinates. xy(:,i) are the [x;y] coordinates of the ith clicked point.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: locate is used to get the coordinates of one or more points selected with the mouse in the current graphic axes. The coordinates values use the data scales of the axes.

If n > 0, n points are expected to be selected. There is no way to escape the series before the nth point is clicked (except with CTRL+C). The coordinates of selected points are returned in the matrix xy.
If n ≤ 0, points are selected until the user clicks the right button of the mouse. The position of this exit click is neither recorded nor returned.
Eventual crosses drawn when clicking are erased when locate() ends.

If the figure is closed (with its top-right cross) while locate() is running on it,
if n>0 : [] is returned.
if n <=0 : The coordinates of points already selected are returned.
refsection.important: Left clicking anywhere out of the current axes of the current figure does not select any point.
refsection.note: Logarithmic and/or reversed axes are supported.
